title: Civics unplugged 2:  A Gen Z community of future builders
description:
This conversation is a follow-up from an earlier conversation with Civics Unplugged ([http://www.civicsunplugged.org](http://www.civicsunplugged.org/)) co-founder, Gary Sheng, which can be watched here: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=soIkDRUV7PE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=soIkDRUV7PE)

This conversation features Madison Adams and Chabu Kapumba, two of the young leaders of Civics Unplugged's community of practice of Generation Z "Future Builders".

You can learn more about Civics Unplugged at [http://www.civicsunplugged.org](http://www.civicsunplugged.org/).

About Gary Sheng:

Gary Sheng is a NYC-based technologist and social entrepreneur dedicated to building tools, systems, and movements that empower people to 1) unplug from everything facilitating human downgrade, and 2) become agents of a better future. Gary was just named to Forbes 30 Under 30 list for 2021 for his work building Civics Unplugged, a social enterprise dedicated to empowering leaders of Gen Z to build the future of American democracy and the civic ecosystem of the world.

Gary co-founded CU after leaving Google. John's work in making sense of the meaning crisis and exploring the power of dialogue has profoundly informed the development and ongoing evolution of Civics Unplugged. You can learn more about Gary and how to connect with him at [garysheng.com](http://garysheng.com/).
